meanings.definition: The act of giving up or surrendering something
meanings.sent1: Her relinquishment of the last piece of cake made her brother very happy.
meanings.sent2: The relinquishment of his seat on the bus to an elderly lady showed his kindness.
meanings.sent3: The cat's relinquishment of the toy mouse led to a playful chase around the room.
meanings.sent4: His relinquishment of control was like releasing a balloon into the sky, watching it float away.
meanings.sent5: The relinquishment of the treasure map to the pirates sealed their fate.

meanings.definition: A formal release or renunciation of a claim or right
meanings.sent1: The relinquishment of his inheritance surprised everyone at the reading of the will.
meanings.sent2: The relinquishment of the company's assets was necessary for the merger to proceed smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's relinquishment of his magical powers left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her relinquishment of the crown symbolized the end of her reign.
meanings.sent5: The relinquishment of the title deed marked the official transfer of ownership.
